name: bool
description: Any boolean value.  There are only 2

name: alphacolor
description: Any color.  This includes both opaque and semitransparent colors.

name: alphacolorstring
description: Any string describing a semitransparent color.  This does not include any colorstring values.

name: alphacolorlist
description: Any list that can describe a semitransparent color.  Every element must be a number and the length must be 4.

name: color
description: Any opaque(not semitransparent) color.

name: colorlist
description: A list of 3 numbers that can describe an opaque color.

name: colorstring
description:
A string that can describe an opaque color.
  • This could be a recognized color name like "red.
  • This could also be a hexadecimal(base 16) color code similar to the format used by HTML, CSS, and JavaScript such as #FF88FF or #F8F.

name: cproc
description: A command or procedure's name.

name: cproc:1
description: A command or procedure's name that has exactly 1 parameter.

name: easing
description: Any easing function value. These can be created by easing commands such as easeInOut, easeIn, easeOut...

name: gradient
description: Any gradient. These can be created by commands such as createLinearGradient, createRadialGradient, and used by commands like setFillGradient, setPenGradient.

name: int
description: Any integer number positive, 0, or negative

name: instructionlist
description: An instruction list. This is used by WebLogo to describe inputs for commands like repeat, for, while, if, ifelse... but it is not something you can store in a variable or pass to a procedure.

name: num
description: Any real or integer number positive, 0, or negative

name: list
description: A list of any type of elements and with any length

name: list|string
description: A list of any type of elements and with any length or any string. The pipe operator, |, can be interpretted like 'or' or 'union'.

name: list<num>
description: A list of numbers with any length

name: list<string>
description: A list of strings with any length

name: plist
description: Any property list. Property lists can be created using the createPList command.

name: string
description: Any string.  This is a type you'd represent using quotes or apostrophes.

name: transparent
description: This is the most specific data type since it contains only 1 value. This is indicated by the transparent command.
